title: nightly-noavx
body:
Hi,
the nightly-noavx, the only docker image with tensorflow compiled without avx library (the lastest-noavx is not present anymore on dockerhub) is not working, below the error(*). 
I don't see any tensorflow directory in the venv environment in the image. The only tensorflow directory is on the main environment.
do you have any suggestion?
Thank you

(*)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/venv/bin/loudmld", line 11, in <module>
    load_entry_point('loudml==1.6.0', 'console_scripts', 'loudmld')()
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 480, in load_entry_point
    return get_distribution(dist).load_entry_point(group, name)
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 2693, in load_entry_point
    return ep.load()
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 2324, in load
    return self.resolve()
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 2330, in resolve
    module = __import__(self.module_name, fromlist=['__name__'], level=0)
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/loudml/__init__.py", line 2, in <module>
    from loudml.donut import DonutModel
  File "/opt/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/loudml/donut.py", line 47, in <module>
    from tensorflow.contrib.keras.api.keras import regularizers
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'tensorflow'
